隔.definition: to separate; to partition; to stand or lie between; at a distance from; after or at an interval of

隔三差五.definition: (idiom) every few days; every once in a while

隔世.definition: separated by a generation; a lifetime ago

隔壁老王.definition: Mr Wang from next door (term used jocularly to refer to a neighbor who is supposedly sleeping with one's wife)

隔天.definition: the next day; on alternate days

隔山.definition: half-sibling relationship; brothers with different mother; step-

隔岸觀火.definition: to watch the fires burning across the river; to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)

隔年皇曆.definition: lit. almanac from years back (idiom); obsolete practice; old-fashioned principle

隔斷.definition: partition; to stand between; wall or fence serving as partition

隔熱.definition: to insulate thermally; insulating (material, effect etc)

隔空.definition: from a distance; through the air; remotely (esp. by means of telekinesis, magic, technology etc)

隔空喊話.definition: to converse with sb by shouting from some distance away; (fig.) to say sth intended for the ears of sb who is not in one's presence (often, by making a public statement or by posting online)

隔絕.definition: to cut off; to isolate; isolated (from the world)

隔膜.definition: diaphragm (anatomy); distant (socially aloof); divided by lack of mutual comprehension; nonexpert

隔行如隔山.definition: different trades, worlds apart (idiom); to sb outside the profession, it is a closed book

隔離霜.definition: pre-makeup cream; makeup base; foundation primer

隔靴搔癢.definition: lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom); fig. beside the point; ineffectual

隔音符號.definition: apostrophe, as used in pinyin orthography (i.e. to mark a boundary between two syllables, as in "dàng'àn" 檔案|档案[dang4 an4])
